entry.title: Death of Peace of Mind
entry.summary:
Author: RenaiRin

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,419Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 64

Summary: Bruce considered when, exactly, the gears of his mind slipped off the mechanical path of cold and calculated focus, only to slam right into buried instinct coming alive once more, and the warmth of the bodies swarming the dance floor around him. He mused it must have been in the split second the world had seemed to shift ever so minutely in his vision, the neon becoming that much brighter, raving dancers melting together in a wave of sweat and heated breath. A softness coated his mind like he'd walked into the path of a massive cooing spiderweb. He'd become that much more acutely aware of a large frame pressing into his back. Yes, that was it. The change. ______ Or, Bruce hooks up with someone at a club. Low and behold, that someone is Clark.

entry.title: Am I making you feel Sick
entry.summary:
Author: fanofthegirl

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,829Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 111

Summary: Hal Jordan was dying long before a mission went wrong and his heart finally gave out. He was dying when he signed the divorce papers. Dying without making it anyone elseâ€™s problem. No one Noticed.Not Bruce. Not Clark. Not the Justice League. And Hal was fine with that because twenty months ago he signed away the right to have anyone worry about him. He would have kept it that way, too If he hadnâ€™t burned himself out saving the world. If he hadnâ€™t collapsed hard enough that everyone finally had to look. Now Bruce and Clark are hovering like they never spent nearly two years avoiding him. Acting like this is their burden to carry, like they didnâ€™t already decide, once, that letting him go was easier than staying. Hal doesnâ€™t understand it. Thereâ€™s no cure. If Oa hasnâ€™t found one, thereâ€™s no point in pretending otherwise. Heâ€™s made peace with dying. Bruce and Clark havenâ€™t. They refuse to give up on him the way they gave up on the marriage. And that more than the poison in his blood or the ache in his chest is what hurts the most. Because Hal is still in love with them. And loving them while they fight to save him might be the one thing he canâ€™t survive.
